title: Case 1

title: Myeloid Findings:  Neutrophil w Döhle bodies
caption:
Myeloid Findings:  Neutrophil w Döhle bodies Myeloid Findings:  Neutrophil w Döhle bodies The Döhle body inclusions are readily noted in this neutrophil

 Döhle bodies are seen in inflammatory states and are composed of agglutinated rough endoplasmic reticulum containing RNA.

title: Myeloid Findings: Pseudo Pelger Huet Neutrophil
caption:
Myeloid Findings: Pseudo Pelger Huet Neutrophil Myeloid Findings: Pseudo Pelger Huet Neutrophil Pelger-Huet anomaly is a congenital autosomal dominant anomaly in which neutrophil nuclei fail to segment normally
In homozygotes , the nucleus is round. In heterozygotes, most granu

title: Leukoerythroblastic Blood Smear
caption:
Leukoerythroblastic Blood Smear Leukoerythroblastic Blood Smear Granulocytic Left Shift
Nucleated Red Blood cells

Caused by stress, hemorrhage, shock
Marrow infiltration also a cause https://vmicro.iusm.iu.edu/virtual_heme/indy_heme_mf.html

title: CML – peripheral blood
caption:
CML – peripheral blood CML – peripheral blood The peripheral blood shows a leukocytosis

 and includes neutrophils at different stages of maturation (including myelocytes, metamyelocytes, promyelocytes), 

an absolute basophilia, and, commonly, eosinophilia

title: AML
caption:
AML AML approximately 15-20 microns in size
high nuclear to cytoplasmic ratio
nucleus is usually round to oval, but may be irregular
chromatin is smooth and open
one or more nucleoli (arrow) may be present
pale blue cytoplasm
cytoplasmic granules are not typically seen, though ra

title: Myeloblast with Auer rod
caption:
Myeloblast with Auer rod Myeloblast with Auer rod Leukemic myeloblasts may contain few cytoplasmic granules or Auer rods (arrow)
reddish, linear structures composed of fused primary granules.  The presence of Auer rods indicates myeloid malignancy.

title: Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia
caption:
Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia Acute Promyelocytic Leukemia heavily granulated cells are abnormal promyelocytes
some containing multiple Auer rods (arrow) and seen in M3, Acute Promyelocytic leukemia
 It is associated with t(15;17)(q22;q12); PML-RARA translocation 
can be treated w

title: A 79 year old man who has not been to the doctor in years who finally comes in for a well check up has his blood work done. He feels well. He has no LAD on exam.  On CBC you see he has a WBC of 35k with 90% of the cells being lymphocytes on differential. What test will you order?What do you think is going on?

title: CLL
caption: CLL CLL Circulating CLL cells may be recognized as mature lymphocytes by the high nuclear cytoplasmic ratio and the characteristic "cobblestone" pattern of the nuclear chromatin.

title: Smudge Cells in CLL
caption: Smudge Cells in CLL Smudge Cells in CLL ASH image bank Smudge cells are seen with small lymphocytes. The lymphocytes in CLL are fragile and can be damaged when making a smear preparation producing this smudged or smeared appearance

title: Smudge Cells in CLL
caption: Smudge Cells in CLL Smudge Cells in CLL ASH image bank Smudge cells are seen with small lymphocytes. The lymphocytes in CLL are fragile and can be damaged when making a smear preparation producing this smudged or smeared appearance

title: Hairy Cell Leukemia
caption:
Hairy Cell Leukemia Hairy Cell Leukemia Those atypical lymphocytes with irregular hair-like cytoplasmic projections are characteristic of hairy cell leukemia
Nuclei are monocytoid/dumbbell-shaped
 It is an indolent lymphoproliferative malignancy that presents with pancytopenia an

caption:

-When Mycoses Fungoides is in the blood Adult T Cell Leukemia Lymphoma
(HTLV-1 associated)

title: Morphology Slide 34
caption:
Reed Sternberg cells – Hodgkin’s Disease bi-lobed nucleus, giving the cell a typical “owl’s eyes” appearance
 They have prominent eosinophilic nucleoli
This cell is seen in Classical Hodgkin lymphoma 
is always strongly CD30 positive by immunohistochemistry. https://vmicro.iusm.i

title: ALL
caption: ALL ALL This blast from a patient with ALL has high nuclear-cytoplasmic ratio(scant cytoplasm), devoid of granules.  Nucleolus (red arrow) is seen - a conspicuous, usually spherical, dense body in the nucleus consisting of protein and RNA:

title: ALL
caption: ALL ALL This blast from a patient with ALL has high nuclear-cytoplasmic ratio(scant cytoplasm), devoid of granules.  Nucleolus (red arrow) is seen - a conspicuous, usually spherical, dense body in the nucleus consisting of protein and RNA:

title: ALL L3 leukemia or Burkitt’s
caption:
ALL L3 leukemia or Burkitt’s ALL L3 leukemia or Burkitt’s These vacuolated cells can be seen in Burkitt’s leukemia/ lymphoma
-mature B cell neoplasm but still more “immature” and often referred to as blasts. https://vmicro.iusm.iu.edu/virtual_heme/indy_heme_burkitts.html

title: Burkitt’s Lymphoma
caption:
Burkitt’s Lymphoma Burkitt’s Lymphoma -Starry Sky Appearance
-tangible body macrophages
-filled with debris from the dying burkitts cell *high turnover
-debris/cytoplasm falls away in staining

title: Burkitt’s Lymphoma
caption:
Burkitt’s Lymphoma Burkitt’s Lymphoma -Starry Sky Appearance
-tangible body macrophages
-filled with debris from the dying burkitts cell *high turnover
-debris/cytoplasm falls away in staining

Plasma cells have round eccentric nuclei and basophilic cytoplasm with a prominent Golgi

title: Finding in Multiple Myeloma:Rouleaux
caption:
Finding in Multiple Myeloma:Rouleaux Finding in Multiple Myeloma:Rouleaux Rouleaux (“stack of coins”) are stacks or aggregations of red blood cells (RBCs) which form because of the discoid shape of the red cells.

 The flat surface of the discoid RBCs gives them a large surface a

title: Giant platelet
caption: Giant platelet Giant platelet This platelet is as large or larger than many of the red cells surrounding it. Such cells are seen in myeloproliferative neoplasms, disorders associated with increased platelet destruction (ITP). Bernard- Soulier syndrome, myelodysplastic syndromes,
